review: Adapted from a 1998 novel of the same title by Tom Perrotta, Alexander Payne Directed 'Election' is a Hilarious film in all respects. It's an absolute delight! 'Election' Synopsis A high school teacher's personal life becomes complicated as he works with students during the school elections.'Election' gets each & every joke right. It gets every moment right. Alexander Payne & Jim Taylor's Adapted Screenplay is Master-Class. It's so well-written & so very worded. Alexander Payne's Direction, on the other-hand, is witty. Cinematography by James Glennon is passable. Editing is sharp. Music by Rolfe Kent is perfect.Performance-Wise Reese Witherspoon is simply outstanding in here. Matthew Broderick is excellent & raises a lot of laughs. The Criminally Under-Rated Chris Klein, is most memorable. Jessica Campbell is flawless. Phil Reeves leaves a mark. Molly Hagan & Colleen Camp lend great support.On the whole, 'Election' is A Winner All The Way!!
